body: @GlamTam Thanks for filing this. Since you want to contribute to it, we welcome and look forward to community help with bug fixes. Please follow the instructions on how to [contribute](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.rst#contribution-process).

Seeing the same issue on Windows (mlflow version 1.17.0) with MSSQL when running `mlflow server --backend-store-uri <uri> --default-artifact-root file:.`.

Error is the same as above (occurs when running the alembic migrations)

found the issue in: versions/c48cb773bb87_reset_default_value_for_is_nan_in_metrics_table_for_mysql.py

``` python
def upgrade():    
# This part of the migration is only relevant for MySQL.    
# In 39d1c3be5f05_add_is_nan_constraint_for_metrics_tables_if_necessary.py    
# (added in MLflow 1.15.0), `alter_column` is called on the `is_nan` column in the `metrics`    
# table without specifying `existing_server_default`. This alters the column default value to    
# NULL in MySQL (see the doc below).    
#    
# https://alembic.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/ops.html#alembic.operations.Operations.alter_column    
#    
# To revert this change, set the default column value to "0" by specifying `server_default`    
with op.batch_alter_table("metrics") as batch_op:       
batch_op.alter_column(            
"is_nan",            
type_=sa.types.Boolean(create_constraint=True),            nullable=False,            server_default="0",        )
```

server_default should be existing_server_default. Will look into creating a PR for the fix.
Hi @GlamTam, I was wondering if you have managed to find a work around for this issue?

@Fl4v , 

- I replaced `server_default ` with `existing_server_default` on a local mlflow==1.16.0 repo. 
- Pip installed mlflow from the local repo. 
- Executed `mlflow db upgrade ...` with this custom mlflow installation.
- upgrade to 1.17 or 1.18 can be done using the regular pypi packages
Hi, are there any timelines for the release of this fix?
only fix I currently see is editing this old migration. Not sure how @dmatrix  thinks about this?
Facing this issue as I try connect to SQL DB as backend-component too. Any updates on this please?

rename.to: [BUG] Alembic migration for metrics table uses incorrect server default

body: Created the PR above to address the issue. Also added a db initialization test for `mssql`. Curious to hear your thoughts! @GlamTam, @dbczumar & @harupy
